title: Good food and a good host
text: Lola was an excellent host to show us around Barcelona through local food. We stopped at many different places to try sweet and savory food and learned some history along the way. We ending the tour with a lunch of paella in a restaurant near the beach. I would definitely recommend this tour
place: 3-Hour Tapas Secret Food Tour in Barcelona w/ Private Tour Option

title: Good price for menu del dia special
text: Had lunch of first course fideua, grilled rabbit, crema Catalan, a glass of cava and a plate of spicy snails for 12 euros. Good food and good price.

title: Nice local market
text: Nice local market where you can pick up cheese, jamon, and olive oil for good prices. There are even restaurant/bars to sit down and have tapas, a meal or drinks.

title: Good tour for my first night in Barcelona
text: Dom was an excellent guide and took us to places we would know to go on our own to taste some of the local flavor. Got to taste a lot of food on the tour and enjoyed the atmosphere of the local restaurants. I would recommend this tour to other people.
place: Barcelona Tapas, Taverns and History Tour

title: You select your fresh seafood and they cook it
text: When you go in, you select the fresh seafood you want to eat (lobster, prawns, clams, scallops, squid, octopus, fish all sitting on ice), tell then how you want it cooked and then they send it to the cooks in back who call you when your order is up. You pay per kilo so you can order as much or as little as you like. And I have top say, it was very good.

title: Small, cozy room--good location and value
text: I booked this on hotel.com without realizing it was basically a hostel. With that being said, the room was small but comfortable. Walking distance to Las ramblas, the beach and other areas. Even though the church bells went off, I didn't hear them enough to disturb my sleep. If you are okay with a hostel type environment, even though you have your own room, this was a good value. Only thing I didn't like was the safe had a skeleton key type set up, so I was worried someone else might have a key so I didn't use it. Breakfast was provided which was good and I had lunch in the restaurant which was also good.

title: Restaurant near Plaza Mayor for tapas at good, fair prices
text: Many of the restaurants near Plaza mayor are set up to take tourist money. I had some good classic tapas dishes at a good price.

title: Interesting market to walk around
text: This market is much better than the Mercado Colon. Produce, fish, meat, spices, a little of everything

title: Great tour to introduce you to greek food
text: Dmitri was an excellent guide for the food tour. He took me to places to take some of the authentic local food and even gave me names of good restaurants to visit. And of course he took me to a place to get real authentic, inexpensive souvlaki. I would definitely recommend this tour especially for your first day in Athens.
place: The 10 Tastings of Athens With Locals: Private Food Tour

title: Basically set up for tourists
text: This is mostly restaurants set up for tourists, not a traditional market. There are places to eat, especially if you order the menu del dia and a place to get really good horchata made with tiger nuts. You can see it once then head down to the Central market for a more standard type market.

title: Good and cheap food and drinks
text: This is a chain restaurant that you can find in many cities in Spain. They offer small bocadillos (sandwiches) for between 1 and 2 euros each and most drinks arealso 1 to 2 euros. They have a special on Sundays and Wednesdays where all bocadillos are 1 euro each. Simple but good food that helps you stretch your budget. may want to google the English menu first as they list 100 different bocadillos and you mark a menu card with the number and quantity of bocadillos you want.

title: Good location, clean quiet room, helpful staff
text: Room was small and cozy but just fine for my purposes. Walking distance to lots of attractions like the Cathedral and Central market. Staff very helpful, especially Fernando at the front desk. I would definitely stay here again--good location.

title: Lots of local flavor on this tour
text: I thoroughly enjoyed this tour with Joy as the guide. She took us to places I couldn't find on my own and we tasted lots of local dishes in local bars where they were known for these dishes. Definitely worth the money.
place: Ultimate Spanish Cuisine Tour in Madrid

title: A chance to check out local tapas bars
text: Jorge was our guide on this tour and he was an excellent guide. We went to places that I wouldn't know to go to and tried things I wouldn't know to order. We did some walking which was enjoyable and learned about the local bars we visited as well as got to try tasty food and drinks.
place: 3-Hour Tapas Secret Food Tour of Madrid w/ Private Tour Option

title: Good walking tour to learn some history
text: Carman was a very knowledgeable guide, particularly with Spanish and Madrid history. It was enjoyable walking around the city in the early evening and learning about that history with Carman
place: Highlights & Hidden Gems With Locals: Best of Madrid Private Tour

title: Recommended to me as best calamari sandwich in Madrid
text: This restaurant is near Plaza Mayor and always has a queue. The calamari sandwich is quick and simple and tastes better than others I've tasted in the city. For 3 eoros it is a good deal along with a cana to wash it down

title: Excellent place for dessert
text: This place serves the traditional dessert loukoumades along with ice cream and other dessert. I had mine with just honey and it was delicious.

title: Great tour, grat meal
text: Meg was the guide and made the tour very interesting. This is the oldest restaurant in the world and to get a chance to see it was quite enjoyable. Also, the meal afterward was also top notch. The suckling pig was as tender and juicy as I expected it to be. Well worth the time and money

title: Excellent chocolate and churros
text: This place is open 24 hours so you should always be able to get in. It does get crowded mid morning until late in the evening and seems to be a stop for some of the tour groups. The chocolate is warm and rich and the churros are good--I preferred the porras which are fat churros. I usually went between 6 and 7 am and there wasn't much of a line to order then.

title: Something to see once--crowded, touristy and more exopensive than other tapas bars in Madrid
text: There are some deals to be had here but mostly this is a tourist food court. There is a place with vermouth on tap here that is good plus some seafood tapas (not the fried fish place as they are a bit expensive).

title: Some history here but dont eat at most of the restaurants on the plaza
text: The plaza is something to see and learn about the history of the area. Told by some locals that the restaurants on the plaza are more expensive and the food not as good as other areas of the city

title: Great local spot for tapas
text: This place is crowded with locals but for learning the art of tapas, it works quite well. Very good patatas bravas here. Also tried vermouth her which was refreshing. Good prices on both tapas and drinks here

title: Not as crowded or touristy as San Miguel
text: Has the traditional market on the 2nd floor and the floor above is where you can get drinks and tapas. You actually have space to sit and have your drinks here.

title: Quite the hub of activity
text: There is so much happening here night and day. Lots of people, costumed characters, singers, musicians, performance artists--it is really something to see and lots of good photo opportunities

title: Great location-value or your money
text: This hotel, is within walking distance of Puerto del Sol, Plaza Mayor, Mercado de San Miguel and other attractions. Good value with clean rooms and helpful staff. Plenty of restaurants nearby. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Well worth the money
text: This was a great introduction to Athens, the Greek culture and especially Greek food. Electra was an excellent guide for this. I tasted something new at each stop and found places I couldn't have found on my own. This is definitely worth the money and would have been better for me if I would have booked it for my first day in Athens.
place: 3-Hour Secret Food Tour Athens of PSYRRI AREA w/ Private Tour Option

title: Lots to look at
text: Market was interesting to see the meat, seafood and produce. Also, good place for olives and nut snacks.

title: Good food at a good price
text: Very good authentic greek food here and the prices weren't jacked up for tourists. I came here for dinner twice and each time was very good.

title: Best ruins i saw while in Athens
text: I was amazed at how much was still intact. There is a lot to see here and the scenery is gorgeous. Lots of interesting artifacts in the museum also. This is a day trip from Athens but very much worth seeing.

title: Beautiful drive and beautiful site
text: This is about an hour away from Athens and makes for a good afternoon. Lots of good photos as the ruins are nice and the spot near the sea is beautiful.

title: This is a must see site when in Athens
text: This was part of an Athens city tour by Chat Tours. It was great to walk up and see all the ruins but was also very crowded. I think it is a must see site when in Athens.

title: Nice hotel close to everything
text: Room was nice and clean and hotel was within walking distance to many sites like the Acropolis. Staff was friendly and helpful. I would stay here again on my next trip. Breakfast is included with the room and includes meats, cheeses, yogurt and some typical greek food as well as eggs and bacon. I loved going for a drink at the bar on the roof at night and seeing the acropolis all lit up.

title: Beautiful scenery while eating dinner
text: Had a wonderful dinner. Started with an octopus appetizer and finished with a very tasty filet. Service was excellent and the view as the sun went down was so beautiful.

title: Beautiful resort and wonderful facilities
text: I came here as part of a group with work. The rooms were nice and the scenery was spectacular. I had a delicious dinner at the Che Ah Chi restaurant. Was up early in the morning taking some of the great hiking trails. I also had the opportunity to experience a few of the spa services and I see why this place is known as one of the top spas in the world. I had never thought of it before, but now I could see myself booking a 3 or 4 night spa package at Mii Amo. Well done!

title: Good for a quick stir fry--you pick your own ingredients
text: This restaurant is close to my work so sometimes I will head in for a late lunch--it can get busy so I will try to go between 2 and 3:30. Lots of good veggies and frozen meats to be grilled by the cooks. And lots of different sauces to flavor your creations with. It's a good price as you can go up for seconds or thirds even if you want

title: Good food--prawns, calamari and oysters on the half shell
text: I enjoyed the food--it was a little pricey but they give you a lot. And the oysters were nice and fresh. Good place for prawns.

title: Nice place to go with a group
text: We were here for a special mother's day buffet and the food was great. Some of the dishes on the buffet were made with game meat (like lasagna) and they were slicing up tasty chicken, beef, lamb and kudu. I had a kudu filet that was a little gamey but with the mushroom sauce they provided, it was absolutely spot on. Also, lots of desserts to choose from

title: Good place to taste African cuisine
text: Great food and great atmosphere. Waitstaff was wonderful, serving each of the 14 courses. Add the drumming and dancing made for great energy and entertainment. Definitely worth the money--about $40 US dollars per person. If there was a particular dish you liked, you can ask them to bring more if you finished it.

title: Good hotel, centrally located
text: Rooms were clean and the price was good. Breakfast buffet had lots of options. Got in on a Sunday afternoon and it was a little scary walking around Green Market square--feels much safer on Monday morning.
place: Holiday Inn Express Cape Town City Centre

title: Beautiful! A must see
text: It was amazing to see this natural wonder. We were given an umbrella from the place we stayed and it came in handy. The sounds coming from the falls are spectacular.

title: Great hotel, helpful staff and an exellent buffet for dinner
text: Didn't plan on being here but flight got cancelled to Vic Falls. Staff was very helpful and accommodating after stress at the airport. And the selections available at the buffet for dinner were amazing. f I am in Johannesburg again, I will stay here. Extra stars for the wonderful staff.

title: Nice room with a beautiful view of the ocean
text: The staff were wonderful and very helpful. We booked this place because the cage diving office was right around the corner so for convenience, we didnt need to wake up so early to see the sharks. The room had a beautiful view of the ocean and there are plenty of great restaurants, especially for seafood within walking distance.

title: Professional crew, I'm not a diver but I loved it
text: On the first day we went out, we didn't see any sharks, the sea was rough and cold and we were told there was a possibility of no sightings. We were offered a discount to come out the next day and we were rewarded by being able to get in the cage and see some sharks. Before we arrived, Apex kept in contact with us and made sure when had all the information. The crew was very knowledgeable and did a good job taking care of the sick people on our first trip. This was my first time in a cage like this and the crew made me feel at ease. I wasn't nervous at all. I would recommend this adventure to anyone.

title: Delicious seafood at a modest price
text: The main thing to order here is fish and chips and they do it well. There are a lot of places in town for fresh seafood, but you pay a lot more. Great place to have lunch after coming off a boat or for take-away.

title: Close to the airport
text: The rooms were night, had a suite on the way back from my trip out f the country which was much nice. overall, the hotel was good except for the fact that I had issues getting the shuttle from the airport. Two times, the driver failed to stop to pick me up. The rooms are clean and perfect for a stayover if you are flying out of the country the next day.

title: Excellent place to treat yourself
text: Just the salad and cold foods buffet was amazing, but with all the delicious cut of meat it puts this place over the top. The waters were constantly coming by with different cuts of meat for us to try. A manager even came by once and asked if there was anything particular we would like to try (we asked for lamb). Service and food were excellent

title: A wonderful volunteering opportunity
text: We spent two weeks volunteering at the wildlife sanctuary and it was a wonderful experience. After arriving on a Monday and going through orientation, we would have different morning and afternoon activities all centered around caring for the animals an conservation. Activities ranged from preparing food for the baboons, rodents, monkeys and tortoises, feeding the large carnivores like lions, cheetahs and African wild dog, setting up motion sensor cameras and analyzing the pictures from them, game rides on horseback and taking the baboons out on walks to socialize. Food and accommodations were great. It's not a petting zoo and I learned a lot about conservation and animal human conflict.

title: Good price,comfortable and a very helpful host
text: We were very happy with the room we stayed in at Victoria Falls. Lorrie was very helpful and helped us book our activities such as a Zambezi river dinner cruise, a visit to an outlying village with a nyanga, and a game walk with the head of the anti-poaching unit of Zambezi national park--all were excellent. We had an issue with one of the local tax drivers and Lorrie was able to take care of it for us. I would definitely stay here again

title: The Game walk was definitely a highlight of visiting Victoria Falls
text: The game walk with Charles was amazing. Getting to the park, we saw lots of animals even before the walk. Charles was very knowledgeable about the animals and birds in the area. We were also follow animals by their tracks and were able to see cape buffalo, zebra and at one point heard lions in the area. Charles always made us feel safe while we were walking. You need to go on a regular safari in a vehicle for that experience, but the game walk gets you much closer to nature and at times, got the adrenaline pumping.

title: Good food and drinks
text: Nice busy place with friendly servers. We ordered a trio of game meats along with an ostrich carpaccio and it was delicious. Drinks were very refreshing. We went in the evening and the pizza also looked good.

title: Lots of good seafood
text: I went here with the intention of eating some good Asian food. Much of it is seafood and tasted very good. I started with barbeque oysters and takoyaki (like an octopus fritter). Lots of good dishes to try--ended the night with a delicious bowl of Ramen. I would go a little early to make sure you can get a parking spot if you are driving.

title: Good place to stock up on food
text: We came here to buy food for a picnic for the next day. Lots of things to buy like fruits, bread, meats, cheese--even bought some home made pickles. It's fun to wander around to see what the vendors are offering. Had some delicious salmon soup at one place and even tried a salmon burger. This is a place the cruise crowd stops at so if you can time it right, the cruise groups will be heading back to their boat or their next location--when we went, it was around 2 or 2:30 pm. Also, parking can be a bit dicey, finding a spot.

title: Gives you the feeling of being in another world.
text: Best to hire a guide to take you there as then you can cut in line to buy your ticket--need to show your passport and get your picture taken. Spent the full day and still didn't see it all. These ruins are beautiful and are definitely worth a trip to Cambodia to see.

title: It's okay if you just want a place near the airport
text: For the price, it's okay. I picked it because they had a free airport shuttle and the price was reasonable. Just needed some place to sleep as I had an early flight at Ohare the next morning. They offer free breakfast in the morning but I think I only had juice, coffee and a muffin.

title: Location good, price good but had some issues with service
text: Rooms are a bit dated but nice. For the most part service was good but I ran into a service issue. I had been in China for about a week already and was coming in from Shanghai. Having been walking around on brick, stone or asphalt for most of my trip, my back was hurting me pretty badly, so I went to the spa to get a massage. The price for a massage was $180 US dollars which was fine but when it was over, I wanted to charge it to my room and I was allowed to but was told that next time I needed to bring money. I walked from the building the spa was in to my building and I asked the desk if I had any messages. They told me I needed to pay for the massage before anything else--I'm used to other places where you settle that up when you check out--I had to go to my room and get my credit card to charge that. So other than making me feel like I was a dead-beat, everything was fine. I stayed at a Mercure in Chang Mai Thailand and had a wonderful experience so I tried them in China-- probably wont go with them again unless I go back to Thailand.

title: Nice little apartment in a good location.
text: Nice apartment in a good location. Subway metro station across the street. Lots of good restaurants within walking distance. Starbucks across the street. A few good noodle restaurants and a chuan chuan hot pot place nearby. Front desk spoke English and was very helpful.

title: Got to see this if in China
text: To see the warriors lined up in the pits was amazing. I booked with Han Tang Tours to see the warriors. We went to 3 different pits and the banpo museum before. It was pretty crowded the day I went. One tip: I would spend a little extra money on a private tour as the general tours end up stopping at a ceramic factory and another shop for about 30 to 45 minutes each( seems like all tours buses and cars stopped here to shop)--you really only need a half day to see this.

title: Great place for animal lovers
text: I booked this half day tour through Viator and was pleased. We left in the morning and it was still cool out. We did see a lot of pandas out as it was still cool in the morning so they weren't hiding. Also got to see the baby pandas in the nursery. Definitely worth seeing if you are in Chengdu.
place: Giant Panda Breeding Research Base (Xiongmao Jidi)

title: Great way to taste local food other than walking down Muslim Street
text: Met our guide Lu at the meeting point and proceeded to visit places that offered local food not found on Muslim street. We did end up in some of the back alleys around Muslim Street but for food we wouldn't normally see. All in all, a good way to spend a few hours and since I booked food tours in Chengdu and Beijing, I got a discount on the tour price.
